intro: Paepalanthus sessilis, commonly known as the clustered buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant has a short, stout stem with basal leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
